text: The Cadillac SRX is a luxury crossover SUV that was first made by the American car manufacturer Cadillac in 2004. It was produced until 2016. The SRX was Cadillac's best-selling model in 2010 and remained popular for several years after. ==First Generation (2004–2009)== The first generation of the Cadillac SRX was introduced in 2004. It was available in front-wheel drive (FWD) and all-wheel drive (AWD) configurations. This generation offered a choice of V6 and V8 engines. The SRX was equipped with safety features such as side airbags and anti-lock brakes. The interior featured leather seats and an infotainment system. The vehicle's design included a smooth front grille and sharp lines. ==Second Generation (2010–2016)== The second generation of the SRX was updated in 2010. The new model had a more modern design and included updated technology features, such as a touchscreen infotainment system, Bluetooth, and a rearview camera. In addition to the V6 engine, a turbocharged four-cylinder engine was also offered in the second generation. The updated SRX provided improved fuel efficiency compared to the previous generation. In 2016, the SRX was discontinued and replaced by the Cadillac XT5. ==Markets== The Cadillac SRX was primarily sold in North America, It was mainly sold in the United States and Canada The SRX was also sold in Mexico, The car was also available in select international markets, including China, where it was imported and In some European countries, the SRX also was sold, although its presence was more limited compared to North America.
